Rule: Achieving higher education (Doctorate or Bachelors) increases the likelihood of earning more than $50k a year.
Being divorced or married, as opposed to being separated, increases the likelihood of earning more than $50k a year.
Being older (specifically, in this case, being 42) may increase the likelihood of earning more than $50k a year.
Achieving higher education (Doctorate) leads to higher income.
If hours worked per week are significantly higher (e.g., 92 hours), the likelihood of earning more than $50k increases.
